name: Methoxphenidine
summary: A dissociative from the diarylethylamine class, a more potent analogue of diphenidine. Known to be unpredictable, and can cause blackouts.
addictionPotential: moderately addictive with a high potential for abuse

tolerance.full: develops with prolonged and repeated use

effects: Auditory hallucination, Auditory distortion, Geometry, Pattern recognition suppression, Double vision, Scenery slicing, Perspective distortion, Environmental cubism, Environmental orbism, Cognitive disconnection, Physical disconnection, Dizziness, Spontaneous bodily sensations, Physical autonomy, Physical euphoria, Thought acceleration, Dream potentiation, Internal hallucination, Autonomous entity, Settings, sceneries, and landscapes, Time distortion, Conceptual thinking, Scenarios and plots, Cognitive euphoria, Visual disconnection, Thought deceleration, Memory suppression, Disinhibition, Tactile suppression, Perception of bodily lightness, Motor control loss, Pain relief, Anxiety suppression, Increased music appreciation, Depersonalization, Derealization, Amnesia, Visual acuity suppression, Spatial disorientation, Gait alteration, Perspective hallucination, Auditory acuity suppression, Visual processing deceleration, Analysis depression, Orgasm depression
